name: Charles the Bald

locations.description: King of West Francia, later Holy Roman Emperor

summary: Charles the Bald was King of West Francia from 840 and Holy Roman Emperor from 875 to 877. He was the youngest son of Louis the Pious and received West Francia (roughly modern France) in the Treaty of Verdun. He was a patron of learning and the arts, continuing the Carolingian Renaissance. He worked closely with Hincmar of Reims and supported the Church. His reign saw the continued fragmentation of the Carolingian Empire and the rise of regional powers.
